term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - functionality, f of a monomer
term.title: functionality

item.text: Number of covalent bonds that a monomer molecule or monomeric unit in a macromolecule or oligomer molecule can form with other reactants.

notes.item: If f = 2, a linear chain macromolecule or a macrocycle can be formed.
If f > 2, a branch point can be formed leading to a branched macromolecule, a network or a micronetwork.
Ethene and ethylene glycol are examples of difunctional monomers, glycerol is an example of a trifunctional monomer, and divinylbenzene and pentaerythritol are examples of tetrafunctional monomers.
